Thunderbirds is a science fiction action-adventure film based on the television series created by Gerry and Sylvia Anderson. In this film, International Rescue (IR), led by widowed former astronaut Jeff Tracy, operates as a secret organisation that aids those in need.
In the film Thunderbirds, Jeff Tracy leads the International Rescue organisation that operates as a secret organisation to aid those in need.

The Hood traps International Rescue (IR) leader Jeff Tracy and four of his sons on board the damaged Thunderbird 5 to steal the other Thunderbirds vehicles and commit heists that IR will be blamed for.
The Hood steals the other Thunderbirds vehicles in the film Thunderbirds to commit heists that International Rescue (IR) will be blamed for.

In the film Thunderbirds, Alan Tracy and his friends Tin-Tin and Fermat stop The Hood who has trapped International Rescue (IR) leader Jeff Tracy and four of his sons on board the damaged Thunderbird 5 to steal the other Thunderbirds vehicles and commit heists that IR will be blamed for.

In the film Thunderbirds, Tin-Tin helps Alan Tracy stop The Hood who has trapped International Rescue (IR) leader Jeff Tracy and four of his sons on board the damaged Thunderbird 5 to steal the other Thunderbirds vehicles and commit heists that IR will be blamed for.

In the film Thunderbirds, Fermat helps Alan Tracy stop The Hood who has trapped International Rescue (IR) leader Jeff Tracy and four of his sons on board the damaged Thunderbird 5 to steal the other Thunderbirds vehicles and commit heists that IR will be blamed for.
The pop-rock band Busted's song 'Thunderbirds Are Go' is featured in the soundtrack of the film Thunderbirds.

The Hood taunts Alan to let him die as his father did, but Alan rescues him, knowing that his father had actually tried unsuccessfully to save the Hood.
The rest of the Tracy family return from space in Thunderbird 3 and confront The Hood at the Bank, where he captures Jeff and Lady Penelope and challenges Alan to defeat him.

faithful writer of the Thunderbirds series, Karey Kirkpatrick was signed on to write the movie adaptation. Although he was not a lifelong fan of the series, Kirkpatrick watched all 32 episodes of the original series to immerse himself within the lore of the series.

In Bill Paxton's preparation for his role in the film, he invited Alan (played by Harry Potter actor Rupert Grint), Jeff (played by Luke Skywalker actor Mark Hamill), and three other actors to a meal. Paxton called this experience empowering and said it helped him know Jeff better. This event further strengthens the relationship between these two characters.
In the movie, Alan's school is shown as Wharton Academy. The filming for this scene took place at Wellington College in Berkshire.
The exterior of Lady Penelope's mansion is shown as Cliveden House in the movie. This location was chosen for its grandeur and beauty.
In the movie, the exterior of the Bank of London is shown as University College London. The filmmakers chose this location due to its distinctive architecture.

The Thunderbirds movie was a box office bomb, grossing $28,283,637 worldwide against an estimated $57 million budget.

The 60-foot model of Thunderbird 3, based on Dominic Lavery's design for the film, was displayed in Trafalgar Square close to the film's release. This shows the promotional efforts made for the film in the iconic location.

The model of Thunderbird 3, based on Dominic Lavery's design for the film, was displayed in Blackpool. This indicates that the promotional efforts made for the film were not limited to London and extended to other locations.

At one point, the model of Thunderbird 3 based on Dominic Lavery's design for the film was decorated with images from Pablo Picasso's Guernica in Blackpool. This highlights the creative elements used to promote the film.

In early 2008, the model of Thunderbird 3 based on Dominic Lavery's design for the film was purchased by Eastern Airways. This shows that the promotional efforts made for the film had a lasting impact.
